Variable: :math:`\text{CH}_4` Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{CH}_4` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: :math:`\text{CO}_2` Clinker Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{CO}_2` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: :math:`\text{CO}_2` Product Use Emission Factor
Information: Unitless carbon dioxide emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{C}` are emitted per tonne of product use.

Variable: :math:`\text{CO}_2` Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{CO}_2` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` GDP Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emitted per billion $USD GDP.

Variable: :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: :math:`\text{NF}_3` Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{NF}_3` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: :math:`\text{SF}_6` GDP Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{SF}_6` emitted per billion $USD GDP.

Variable: :math:`\text{SF}_6` Production Process Emission Factor
Information: Unitless emission factor (tonne/tonne) representing how tonnes of :math:`\text{SF}_6` emitted per tonne of production

Variable: Average Lifespan of Housing Construction
Information: Average lifespan, in years, of housing construction. Used to estimate replacement of old stock housing.

Variable: Average per Household Demand for Construction Materials
Clinker Fraction of Cement
Notes: See Equation 2.2 in V3

Variable: COD Wastewater Factor
Information: Mass of chemical oxygen demand (COD) generated per tonne of production.

Variable: Industrial Production Scalar
Information:
| Exogenous scalar that can be used to represent exogenous shocks todemand (assuming production and demand are in equilibrium).
 | 
 | **NOTE:** Excludes categories that are derviced from model integration, including agricultural and livestock production (AFOLU) and recycling (Circular Economy)

Variable: Initial Industrial Production
Information: Production at :math:`t = 0` of an industrial category, in tonnes. Future production is elastic to GDP and is modified by an exogenous scalar (representing changes to industry).

Variable: Initial Non-Energy Fuel Use
Information: Includes paraffin wax and lubricant use
Notes:
| Paraffix wax use by country is available from `UN Data <http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?d=EDATA&f=cmID%3APW#EDATA>`_
 | 
 | Lubricant use by country is available from `UN Data <http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?d=EDATA&f=cmID%3ALU>`_

Variable: Initial Other Non-Energy :math:`\text{CO}_2` Emissions
Maximum Recycled Material Ratio in Virgin Process
Information:
| Recycled material can sometimes be mixed in with virgin materials
 | 
 | **Cullet Ratio in Glass**: *Cullet* is scrap glass that is used to reduce the requirements for raw materials in glass production. In SISEPUEDE, recycled glass is used until the maximum cullet fraction (on average) is satisfied. Recycled glass above this threshold is exported.  See `Nature 599 (2021) <https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-021-02992-8>`_ and the V3, C2, Equation 2.10 in the IPCC GNGHGI (2006) for more information.

Variable: Net Imports of Cement Clinker
Notes:
| Exogenous specification of net imports of cement clinker.
 | 
 | Net imports of cement clinker are used to adjust cement productions emissions from clinker--i.e., if net imports are negative, then clinker beyond what is used for cement is exported, meaning that production emissions exceeded what was used for endogenous cement production.
Reference: See the World Bank World Integrated Trade Solution ` WITS Imports <https://wits.worldbank.org/trade/comtrade/en/country/ALL/year/2019/tradeflow/Imports/partner/WLD/product/252310>`_ for clinker imports by country and `WITS Exports <https://wits.worldbank.org/trade/comtrade/en/country/ALL/year/2019/tradeflow/Exports/partner/WLD/product/252310>`_ for clinker exports by country.

Variable: Industrial Production
Information:
| Production at :math:`t = 0` of an industrial category, in tonnes. Future production is elastic to GDP and is modified by an exogenous scalar (representing changes to industry). 
 | 
 | Note that production of recycled categories (``recycled_XXX``) differ from total waste recycled. In the Industrial model, recycled materials are used until the maximum recycling fraction is obtained.

Variable: Other Fluorinated Compound Emissions from Industrial Product Use
Information:
| Aggregate emissions, across all specified non-PFC/HFC flourinated compounds (including HCFCs, halogenated alcohols, ethers, furans, aldehydes, and ketones, where applicable), resulting from industrial production processes. 
 | 
 | Includes HCFC-141b and HCFC-142b

Variable: Other Fluorinated Compound Emissions from Industrial Production Processes
Information:
| Aggregate emissions, across all specified non-PFC/HFC flourinated compounds (including halogenated alcohols, ethers, furans, aldehydes, and ketones, where applicable), resulting from industrial production processes. 
 | 
 | Includes Dodecafluoropentane,:math:`\text{NF}_3`, and Octafluorooxolane.

Variable: PFC Emissions from Industrial Product Use
Information: Aggregate emissions, across all specified PFCs, resulting from product use in industry.

Variable: PFC Emissions from Industrial Production Processes
Information: Aggregate emissions, across all specified PFCs, resulting from industrial production processes.

Variable: PFC-1114 Emissions from Industrial Production Processes
Information: | Used in calibration to key industrial subsectors using data from `Minx et al. (2021) <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-13-5213-2021>`_

Variable: Recycled Material Used in Industrial Production
Information: Production of recycled categories (``recycled_XXX``) differ from total waste recycled. In the Industrial model, recycled materials are used until the maximum recycling fraction is obtained. This variable gives the total mass of recycled waste used in industrial production.
